revised_title: Geological Evolution and Stratigraphic Subdivision of the Tibetan Plateau
tldr: This article presents a preliminary stratigraphic subdivision and correlation along the Qinghai-Xizang (Tibet) highway from Lhasa to Golmud and its adjacent areas. The authors discuss the geological evolution of Tibet, focusing on the three major provinces along the Geotraverse route: the Kunlun Terrane, the Qiangtang Terrane, and the Lhasa Terrane. They also provide insights into the age and correlation of various formations and discuss the significance of fossils found in the region.
